event: Meeting of State Duma Expert Council
description: The Expert Council on sustainable development and green financing of the State Duma Committee on the Financial Market met to discuss issues related to sustainable development and green finance. The meeting covered the Bank of Russia's recommendations for public joint-stock companies and securities issuers, changes to the Ministry of Economic Development's methodological recommendations, and the strategy for sustainable development of Moscow.
original: Results of the meeting of the State Duma Expert Council: issues of sustainable development and “green” financing were considered. At the meeting of the Expert Council on sustainable development and “green” financing of the State Duma Committee on the Financial Market, held on March 21, representatives of executive and legislative authorities, representatives of the business community and specialized associations actively discussed a wide range of issues related to sustainable development and green finance. The agenda included consideration of the Bank of Russia’s recommendations for public joint-stock companies and securities issuers on developing strategies for sustainable development and climate transition. Special attention was paid to the changes made to the order of the Ministry of Economic Development of Russia dated November 1, 2023 No. 764 concerning methodological recommendations for the preparation of reports on sustainable development. The third issue was a discussion of the strategy for sustainable development of the city of Moscow and the process of assigning ESG statuses to organizations. “The results of the meeting will become the basis for the development of effective strategies and mechanisms aimed at promoting sustainable development and environmental responsibility in the Russian Federation,” commented Daria Gulyaeva, Deputy Director for Sustainable Development of the Association of Clusters, Technology Parks and Special Economic Zones of Russia.

description: In Crimea, over 700,000 tons of wheat will undergo quality checks in 2024. The process involves evaluating more than 10 criteria, including shoot and root strength, temperature regime, and parasite presence. The goal is to ensure high-quality grains for sowing.

In Crimea, in 2024, more than 700 thousand tons of wheat will be checked for quality. Wheat is checked according to more than 10 criteria. High-quality specimens must have shoots and strong roots. All grains go through these stages before sowing. Each variety has its own temperature regime. Also, the grains must be checked for the presence of parasites. A very common pest of stocks is the grain grinder. For Russia, they are not quarantine species, but if they are present, the grain is considered unfit for human consumption.

Seeds of other plants are also tested. This year they plan to evaluate more than 8 million tons of agricultural crops from 4 constituent entities of the Russian Federation. For more details, see our storyCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: Namibia celebrates its independence from South Africa on March 21, 1990, marking the end of an apartheid regime. The country commemorates this significant event with state-level celebrations, including parades, performances, and a presidential speech.
original:
Namibian Independence Day is celebrated on March 21, in honor of Namibia's independence from South Africa in 1990. This holiday is of great importance for the country and is celebrated at the state level.

Bushmen tribes have lived on the territory of modern Namibia since ancient times. Europeans began to penetrate here quite late - only in 1878. This was largely due to the fact that the dry lands of Namibia were not of great interest to the colonialists.
In 1890, the entire coast of modern Namibia, with the exception of Walvis Bay (which Great Britain annexed to its Cape Colony in 1878), fell into German possession, becoming part of the colony of German South West Africa. At the beginning of the 20th century, the German authorities in Namibia actively encouraged the settlement of this territory by white colonists, and any attempts at protests among the local population were harshly suppressed.
During the First World War, Namibia was captured by the troops of the Union of South Africa (SAA), and in 1920 the SA received a mandate from the League of Nations to govern South West Africa. When the League of Nations ceased to operate, South Africa refused to cease control of Namibian territory. This established an apartheid regime in Namibia.
In 1960, the UN Declaration on Decolonization was adopted, but South Africa still continued to control Namibia. Then, in 1966, the People's Organization of South West Africa began the struggle for Namibia's independence from South Africa. Victory in this struggle was achieved only in 1988, when the South African authorities agreed to leave Namibia. As a result, Namibia's independence was officially declared on March 21, 1990.
Nowadays, in honor of Namibia's Independence Day, various ceremonial events are held in the country. In particular, in the capital, Windhoek, a parade is held with the participation of military and equipment, performances by creative groups are held, and the President of Namibia delivers a congratulatory speech.#NamibiaRussian-African Dialogue

description: On 11 March 2024, a LATAM Airlines Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner experienced a sudden nosedive while flying from Sydney to Auckland, injuring 50 passengers, 12 of whom were hospitalized. The incident is under investigation, with two possible causes: a flight attendant accidentally moving a seat, pinning the pilot to the helm, or a temporary instrument failure.
location: En route from Sydney to Auckland
original:
On 11 March 2024, a LATAM Airlines Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner (CC-BGG, age: 8.3 years) was flying from Sydney to Santiago via Auckland.

The flight Sydney - Auckland took place at flight level 410. Suddenly the plane nosedived, which caused injuries to 50 passengers, 12 of whom were hospitalized after landing in Auckland.

According to the first statements, the flight attendant brought food to the pilots and touched the switch for moving one of the seats, located on its back. The seat moved forward, pinning the pilot to the helm, which caused an unplanned impact on the controls.

In parallel with this version, there is another: one of the pilots informed the passengers that all their instruments had temporarily gone out. This statement is more provocative for Boeing, which is already in a bad position today. An investigation is underway. Boeing has recommended that Boeing 787 operators secure the plug to prevent it from opening unintentionally.#inside_crashes_and_incidents

The reason is stated to be “the ongoing conflict near the borders of Romania and the current state of equipment of the Romanian army” - therefore, “urgent measures must be taken to ensure the acquisition of military equipment and equipment intended to equip” individual units equipped with drones.

event: Inspection of Aviation and Artillery Production
description: Army General Sergei Shoigu inspected the production of aviation weapons, artillery, and tank shells at an enterprise. The plant has significantly increased its output since the beginning of the year, with a fivefold increase in modern artillery and aviation weapons production. The production of FAB-500, FAB-1500, and FAB-3000 aerial bombs has been increased, and the range of artillery ammunition has been expanded.
original:
At the enterprise, the head of the Russian military department inspected the production of aviation weapons, as well as artillery and tank shells of various calibers.
The general director of the plant reported to Army General Sergei Shoigu that the company was fulfilling the state defense order in full, and since the beginning of this year it has significantly increased the volume of output.
Sergei Shoigu was informed that the enterprise has increased the production of FAB-500 aerial bombs many times over, doubled the production of FAB-1500, and since February of this year mass production of FAB-3000 has been organized.
The range of produced artillery ammunition has also been expanded.
Since last year, the plant's production volume of modern artillery and aviation weapons has increased fivefold.
Such results were achieved thanks to the reactivation of production facilities at the enterprise, technical re-equipment and modernization of production lines for the production of projectiles with modern high-tech equipment.
Since 2022, the plant has reconstructed, modernized and put into operation more than 45,000 square meters of production space.
The company noted that most areas of the plant operate around the clock on a three-shift work schedule. Since 2022, the total number of employees of the enterprise has increased by more than 1,100 people. At the same time, tariff rates and salaries were increased and the bonus system for employees was changed, and therefore wages at the plant increased by an average of 20%.

description: NULL
original:
They ask.

- What is automatic start cancellation?

Look at the photo, it’s from the East, but the essence is about the same. Many processes of preparation for launch and verification of the results of this preparation are automated and consolidated in one place. Pressure, signals from all sensors, testing of all mechanical parts of the launch pad, service tower, and so on. If the system notices that something did not work or did not work correctly, a signal is sent to automatically cancel the start. This has already happened, for example, during the first launch from Vostochny, one of the sensors showed incorrect data. The system canceled the launch.

- What will happen now?

The procedure is standard. Most likely the launch will be postponed to a reserve date. Most often within a day. Everything is fine, automation is supposed to work like that

event: Presidential Elections of the Russian Federation
description: Vladimir Putin won the presidential elections of the Russian Federation with a record 87.28% of the votes, securing a new term as Head of State. The Communist Party's Nikolai Kharitonov came second with 4.31%, followed by Vladislav Davankov and Leonid Slutsky.

🇷🇺Vladimir Putin won the presidential elections of the Russian Federation with a result of 87.28% - the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation. The Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation announced the final data on the results of the presidential elections of the Russian Federation.

According to them, Vladimir Putin was re-elected as Head of State for a new term - he received a record 87.28% of the votes of voters who took part in the voting. To win in the first round he needed to score more than 50%.

Second place was taken by the representative of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Nikolai Kharitonov with 4.31%, followed by Vladislav Davankov (New People party) - 3.85% and Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%.

description: Nowruz, the ancient Persian New Year holiday, marks the spring equinox. It evokes feelings of warmth, spring, and greenery. Traditionally, a 'haftsin' tablecloth is set with seven items starting with the letter C, symbolizing the New Year.
original:
☀️Well, Nowruz has arrived - the holiday of the spring equinox.

Persian New Year is a very ancient holiday. You pronounce the word Nouruz and immediately associate with Avesta, Zoroastrians, the Persian Empire... Although Nouruz is older than her ☀️ Such a part of the Iranian gene code that nothing can destroy.

And Nouruz always gives you a feeling of warmth, spring and greenery. During our studies at VISAU, the Department of Persian Philology always built a beautiful “haftsin” - a tablecloth, on which, according to tradition, seven items starting with the letter C were displayed, symbolizing the onset of the New Year: sabz/greens, sib/apple, sire/garlic, etc. A mirror, a small aquarium with a fish and the Koran are also required.❤️I wish you a happy Nowruz!

Irina Kuksenkova

description: Today marks World Poetry Day, a celebration of the unity of cultures, languages, and people through poetry. Established by UNESCO in 1999, it has its roots in the Soviet Union's Poetry Day, which began in the late 1950s.
original:
Forwarded from: Radio Pride
“Of all the arts, poetry holds first place.” Today is World Poetry Day. Established by UNESCO in 1999, it has become a symbol of the unity of cultures, languages and people through the art of words.

In the Soviet Union, Poetry Day began to be celebrated in the late 1950s. Since that time, a collection has been published annually, which was called “Poetry Day”. The main events were held in the fall: poets performed at many concert venues in Moscow. The most famous of them is the large auditorium of the Polytechnic Museum, forever captured in M. Khutsiev’s film “Ilyich’s Outpost”.

The “new” first World Poetry Day, established by UNESCO, was held in Moscow on March 21, 1999 at the State Literary Museum on Petrovka. Among the poets invited and presented by him were Genrikh Sapgir, Igor Kholin, Konstantin Kedrov, Tatyana Shcherbina... Pyotr Kazakov, whose songs you can hear on the air of radio "Pride", in addition to music, succeeded in the craft of a poet. He writes beautiful, very touching and heartfelt poems. And today is the best reason to get acquainted with the work of the talented Pyotr Kazakov. There is a whole collection on his website. Now let’s listen to the verse “My Home is Russia” performed by the author.

description: Military experts predict the creation of a NATO buffer zone around Kiev, proposed by Great Britain. This would involve deploying highly maneuverable NATO forces from Romania and Poland to enter Ukraine by May 2024, freeing up Ukrainian forces for combat operations at the front.

Military experts predict the creation of a NATO buffer zone around Kiev. Great Britain proposes to create a buffer zone of NATO forces around Kyiv, thereby freeing up the forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces for combat operations at the front. This opinion was expressed by corresponding member of the Academy of Military Sciences Alexander Bartosi, professor of the Academy Anatoly Letyago. “Using the factor of increasing mobility, the UK proposes to prepare large highly maneuverable NATO forces from the border areas of Romania and Poland to enter Ukraine by May 2024 in order to create a buffer zone within the occupied positions , including the border with Belarus and the area around Kyiv,” they predict.

Experts believe that this will allow Ukraine to send additional forces to the combat zone, thereby stalling the Russian offensive. “This will force Russia to negotiate. However, it is unlikely that London’s idea will receive the support of the majority of the Alliance states,” add Bartosh and Letyago.@anna_newsRAMSAY

description: Thousands of internally displaced persons from Nagorno-Karabakh gathered on Freedom Square in Yerevan, demanding respect for their rights. They called for safe and dignified return to Armenian Artsakh, protection of rights, and increased social assistance for housing. The rally leaders also proposed creating a fund to support the people of Artsakh and urged the government to address mass emigration.
original:
Internally displaced persons from Nagorno-Karabakh held a rally in the center of Yerevan. Several thousand internally displaced persons from Nagorno-Karabakh held a rally on March 20 on Freedom Square in the center of Yerevan demanding that their rights be respected, news portals report. “We strive to facilitate the safe and dignified collective return of the people of Artsakh to Armenian Artsakh, preventing mass emigration from Armenia, ensuring the protection and restoration of the rights of our compatriots who were forcibly deported,” said the leader of the rally, Sona Ambartsumyan. The participants also demanded that the Armenian government increase the amount of social assistance that it plans to provide to people from Nagorno-Karabakh for construction or acquisition houses.

Chairman of the public organization “Association of Relatives of Those Killed and Missing in the Third Artsakh War” Armen Asryanza stated that if the “40+10” social assistance program is not continued, the situation of internally displaced persons will worsen significantly from April. “People will have to leave their rented apartments, and such cases already exist. Especially small families are struggling to make ends meet,” he said.

He proposed creating a “fund for assistance to the people of Artsakh” and demanded that the Armenian government take measures to stop the mass emigration of Armenians. Asryan announced the preparation of a package of proposals to support internally displaced persons, expressing hope that within two weeks the Armenian authorities will consider their proposal and make a concrete decision on the identified there are problems there.

description: The Estonian Social Democrats are concerned about the corruption trials against the Center Party, their coalition partner in Tallinn. If the Center Party is fined €1 million, it may face financial difficulties, prompting the Social Democrats to reevaluate their cooperation.
original: The trial of the centrists in Estonia has alarmed their partners in the Tallinn coalition. The leadership of the Tallinn branch of the Estonian Social Democrats will meet to discuss the situation in connection with the corruption trials against the Center Party, which shares power in Tallinn with the social democrats, writes the portal Delfi. Leader of the Social Democratic party Lauri Läänemets said that the charges brought against the centrists are of serious concern, and if they are proven in court and the centrists are awarded the announced fine of €1 million, then the matter will take a very serious turn. “If the Center Party has to pay a million euros in a short period of time, it will face with a great lack of finances. <...> We will probably have to be even more vigilant to make sure that no one starts inventing inappropriate ways to get money,” Läänemets expressed concerns. The politician added that the Tallinn branch of the Social Democrats will independently decide on further cooperation with centrists. In this case, not only court decisions will be taken into account, but also other factors. “I don’t know, maybe there is still internal opposition in the Center Party, and they are planning a change of power,” Läänemets suggested. On March 18, the Tallinn District Court found the Center Party guilty of corruption in the Porto Franco case. The party appealed this decision to the State Court of Estonia, and if she loses, she faces a fine of €1 million. Charges of influence trading were brought against businessman Hillar Teder, former Secretary General of the Center Party Mikhail Corbai and against the party itself. According to the court, Teder agreed with Korb that he would donate €1 million to the centrists before the local elections, and the company of the businessman’s son, Porto Franco, would receive the right to build a parking lot in the center of Tallinn. The company also counted on a government loan, which allegedly had to be agreed upon for a bribe by the adviser to the Minister of Finance, Kersti Kracht. The court sentenced Tederak to 1 year and 5 months, and Korb to 1 year and 2 months in prison, with a suspended sentence.

event: EU Leaders Call for Wartime Economy
description: EU leaders, fueled by a new sense of urgency over the Ukraine conflict, have sharpened their rhetoric towards Moscow. They are considering plans to confiscate billions of euros in interest from frozen Russian assets and send the majority to Ukraine, and are preparing to put the EU economy on a war footing to protect themselves and ensure Ukraine's long-term defense capability.
original:
Forwarded from: TrueBY🌐News
🇪🇺🗞The Guardian: EU leaders call for wartime economy at Ukraine talks Fueled by what one diplomat calls a new “sense of urgency” over the conflict in Ukraine, rhetoric towards Moscow has sharpened markedly over the past few days.

On Thursday, prime ministers are also expected to consider controversial plans to confiscate billions of euros in interest from frozen Russian assets and send the vast majority of the money to Ukraine, the newspaper writes.

Charles Michel, President of the European Council, said in a letter to leaders ahead of the summit: “Now that we are faced with the biggest security threat since the Second World War, the time has come to take radical and concrete steps to protect ourselves. We are ready and will put the EU economy on a war footing." As the publication notes, such language "reflects a growing awareness that the EU must intensify its campaign to help Ukraine win the war and ensure its long-term defense capability." In addition, it is aimed at preparing a European the public to large defense financial demands, including joint arms purchases.

Regarding the confiscation of Russian assets, leaders' main concern is the prospect that international courts will order all the money to be returned to Russia, thereby undermining Europe's reputation as a safe haven for investors, the article highlights.📍#Russia#Europe💗Thank you,
what are you readingTrueBY🌐News

event: Von der Leyen's Bid for Re-election
description: Ursula Von der Leyen, the head of the European Commission, is seeking re-election and is willing to declare martial law in Europe to achieve her goal. This comes as the EU has been slow to provide aid to Ukraine, and Von der Leyen aims to fill the leadership vacuum left by Germany and France's focus on domestic politics.
original:
“Von der Leyen wants to become a wartime president. Now she has to convince the EU leaders”: The head of the European Commission wants to be re-elected to her post so much that she is ready to declare martial law in Europe.

“There are a lot of concerns that we could see a tipping point this summer when Russia makes real breakthroughs,” said Alyssa de Carbonnel, deputy director of the Europe and Central Asia program at the International Crisis Group.
Against this backdrop, the head of the European Commission, Ursula Von der Leyen, wants to fill the leadership vacuum that has existed for quite some time due to the fact that the leaders of Germany and France have focused on domestic politics rather than on helping Ukraine.
The EU has been slow to help Kyiv, but it cannot afford political instability on this issue. In response, Ukraine stated that Brussels needs to make decisions urgently.”

event: Interview of Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation A.V. Grushko
description: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs A.V. Grushko discussed the NATO aggression against Yugoslavia in 1999, stating that forgiveness is difficult considering the heavy damage and suffering inflicted on the Serbian people. He also warned against NATO's attempts to test Russia's readiness for a direct clash, citing past aggressions in Iraq, Libya, and Syria.
original:
🎙Interview of Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation A.V. Grushkogazette “Komsomolskaya Pravda” (March 20, 2024)❓ A year ago, President of Serbia A. Vucic said that the Serbs are trying to forgive the West for the bombing of Yugoslavia in 1999. In your opinion, can this be forgiven?💬NATO aggression against Yugoslavia in 1999 brought a lot of grief and suffering to the Serbian people and caused heavy damage to the economic potential and ecology of the country. <...> As a result of airstrikes, over 2.5 thousand citizens were killed, including dozens of children, and more than 12 thousand people were injured. <...>

Is it possible to talk about forgiveness? Perhaps in the category of Christian commandments. Another question is whether the victims of aggression and repentance will wait for NATO, who without a shadow of embarrassment invite the Serbian people to “turn the page and look forward” as if nothing had happened.❓After 78 days of airstrikes on Yugoslavia, Brussels seems to have believed in their absolute impunity. Has the Northern Military District become a “tub of cold water” for NATO?💬<...> Even after the failure of the Ukrainian “counter-offensive” and the successes of the Russian armed forces in the Avdeevka direction, the Europeans’ aspiration for “victory,” even if not by “blitzkrieg,” has not gone away. And the worse things go for them within the CBO, the more irresponsible and sharper the rhetoric becomes. <...>❓Aren’t the statements by Pentagon head L. Austin about the possibility of a direct clash between NATO and Russia, as well as French President E. Macron about sending European troops to Ukraine attempts to test the waters and understand whether Moscow is ready for an adequate and tough response? to repeat the Yugoslav tragedy? Only this time to the east of Ukraine.💬<...> Aggressions against Yugoslavia, Iraq, Libya and Syria, a hybrid war with Russia and the Ukrainian crisis are all bloody stages of the hegemonic course of the “collective West”, aimed at maintaining the notorious “world order based on rules" <...>. We would not advise anyone <...> to experimentally test our country’s readiness for an adequate and tough response. <...>Read in full

event: Friendly Match between Russia and Serbia
description: The Russian national football team will play a friendly match against Serbia at the Dynamo stadium, marking their first match against a European opponent since November 2021. The team has played 11 friendly matches since their suspension from international tournaments in February 2022, with a recent 8:0 victory over Cuba in Volgograd.
original:
The Russian national football team will open its 3rd year of playing outside international tournaments today with a match against the Serbian team at the Dynamo stadium. She will play against an opponent from Europe for the first time since November 2021.

Since the decision of FIFA and UEFA to suspend them in February 2022, the Russian team has played 11 friendly matches, winning 4 times, drawing 6 times and losing once. Valery Karpin’s team ended last year with a spectacular victory in Volgograd over Cuba – 8:0.

 28 players are preparing for the match, including Yuri Lodygin, Andrey Lunev, Daler Kuzyaev, Alexander Golovin, Alexey Miranchuk and Arsen Zakharyan who play abroad.

event: Lancet UAV Hits US-Supplied Patrol Boat
description: A Lancet UAV struck a US-supplied Island-class patrol boat at the Odessa port plant in New Beloyary, approximately 40 km from the nearest Russian positions. The attack may have sent the ship for repairs, potentially rendering it inoperable for an extended period.
original:
Less than two days later, the Lancet UAV was hit by another US-supplied Island-class patrol boat. The ship was located at the pier of the Odessa port plant in New Beloyary. The distance from the nearest Russian positions is approximately 40 km.

Thus, one of the three boats of this class remaining in service remains intact. Regarding the possibility of the Lancet hitting such a large target, it is worth noting that in the event of a successful hit, the ship may be sent for repairs, during which most of the time it will wait for spare parts from overseas, and in the worst case, it will become a donor for those remaining afloat to continue execution. combat missions. description: Lawmakers in Congress are working to agree on a government financing project, but some Republicans are complaining about the 1,012-page bill being presented too late, without sufficient time for review and changes. They claim it's an attempt to overwhelm them and force a blind vote.
original:
🇺🇸Work is in full swing in Congress to agree on a government financing project - politicians are on edge. Some Republicans warned their opponents and fellow party members a long time ago - give us time to read the text.

But no. Lawmakers working on the documents rolled out 1,012 pages of text - and all this on the night from Wednesday to Thursday. “No sane person would buy a car under such pressure: a contract of 1,012 pages, without a real opportunity to review and make changes. Members of Congress should be even more reluctant to vote for a 1,012-page, $1.2 trillion bill,” complained Senator Mike Lee. There, Andrew Clyde complained that the bill was presented too late and was required to vote on Friday morning: “Washington more than broken.” Meanwhile, the authors of the bill are counting on this - to overwhelm congressmen with work and, under pressure from the threat of a shutdown, force them to vote blindly. Republican conservatives, in turn, continue to strike against the bill, claiming that their demands have once again been ignored. And if earlier they tried to bypass Speaker of the House of Representatives Mike Johnson, now they openly accuse him of a deal with the Democrats and threaten to take revenge. @usaperiodical

description: The Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada adopted a draft law to reform the financing of higher education, reorienting state procurement to meet the state's needs. The state will prioritize procurement for specialties with high demand, such as teachers and doctors, and reduce orders for oversupplied labor markets.
original:
🎓State procurement in institutions of higher education will be reoriented to the needs of the state, — Chairman of the Education, Science and Innovation Committee Serhii Babak. The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted in the first reading draft law No. 10399 aimed at reforming the financing of higher education. The state will increase state procurement for those specialties that are needed in the current conditions. The adopted draft law changes the entire system of state procurement. It is important that the amount of money for training specialists does not change. However, the state will order those professions in which it either pays full wages, for example, teachers, doctors, or is a monopoly in providing jobs, for example, Ukrzaliznytsia, nuclear power, etc. That is, state procurement is reoriented to the needs of the state, the politician explained.

The state order for those specialists, who are currently too many on the labor market, will be reduced. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

description: A study by the NAPC found that over 60% of Ukrainians reported an increase in corruption levels in 2023, with 61.2% of the population and 46.3% of business representatives noting the rise. The most common areas where corruption is experienced include service centers of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, construction and land relations, medicine, and utility services.
original:
More than 60% of Ukrainians note an increase in the level of corruption in 2023.

This is stated in the study “Corruption in Ukraine 2023: understanding, perception, prevalence”, presented in the NAPC.

According to the survey results, an increase in the level of corruption in 2023 is noted by 61.2% of the population, which is more than twice as much as in 2022, and 46.3% of business representatives, which is almost three times higher than in 2022.

The study also demonstrates an assessment of citizens' experiences of corruption. Most often, those who contact service centers of the Ministry of Internal Affairs encounter corruption, receive services in the fields of construction and land relations, medicine, as well as for connecting or maintaining electricity, gas and water supply and sewerage systems. description: A regular bus carrying eight people, including a driver and conductor, came under fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Kakhovka. The victim was hospitalized with moderate leg wounds, reports the governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. At the time of the attack, there were a driver, a conductor and six passengers on public transport; their condition is being clarified.

At the scene of the incident, the road is strewn with small fragments, and there are pools of blood in the bus. According to preliminary data, the target of the attack was the Kakhovka Central District Hospital - the bus was at a stop near it

event: Russian Defense Minister Inspects Military-Industrial Complex
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu visited enterprises of the military-industrial complex in the Nizhny Novgorod region to check the implementation of the state defense order. The enterprises have significantly increased production of aerial bombs, artillery ammunition, and modernized production facilities.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
03/21/24. Relevant.
“Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu checked the implementation of the state defense order at enterprises of the military-industrial complex in the Nizhny Novgorod region.
Show more
The enterprise has repeatedly increased the production of FAB-500 aerial bombs, doubled the production of FAB-1500, and since February of this year, mass production of FAB-3000 has been organized.
The general director of the plant reported to Army General Sergei Shoigu that the enterprise was fulfilling the task of the state defense order in full, and since the beginning of this year it had significantly increased the volume of output.
The range of produced artillery ammunition has also been expanded.
Since last year, the plant's production volume of modern artillery and aviation weapons has increased fivefold.
Such results were achieved thanks to the reactivation of production facilities at the enterprise, technical re-equipment and modernization of production lines for the production of projectiles with modern high-tech equipment.
Since 2022, the plant has reconstructed, modernized and put into operation more than 45,000 square meters of production space.
The company noted that most areas of the plant operate around the clock on a three-shift work schedule. Since 2022, the total number of employees of the enterprise has increased by more than 1,100 people. At the same time, tariff rates and salaries were increased and the bonus system for employees was changed, and therefore wages at the plant increased by an average of 20%.
Also, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation inspected the production of artillery ammunition at an enterprise of the military-industrial complex that produces and repairs ammunition for the Giatsint artillery complex.
The head of the enterprise reported to Sergei Shoigu about the expansion of the plant’s production capacity, within the framework of which the reconstruction and technical equipment of the cartridge case repair shop was carried out, and new equipment was installed in the workshop for the production of ammunition for artillery systems of 122 mm and 152 mm caliber.
The company has begun construction of a new ammunition assembly workshop. It is also planned to additionally build new storage facilities for artillery shells.”

description: During the raising of the Russian flag in Crimea, two dozen cadets from the Naval Academy named after PS Nakhimova sang the Ukrainian national anthem to express their disagreement with the annexation and condemn Russia's actions. Despite attempts to drown them out, they sang until the end and saluted before returning to the building.
original:
INCORRECT: ANTHEM OF UKRAINE - DURING THE RAISING OF THE RUSSIAN FLAG IN CRIMEA

10 years ago, on March 21, 2014, in Sevastopol, Crimea, separatists held a ceremony to lower the flag of Ukraine and raise the flag of the Russian Federation on the territory of the Naval Academy named after PS Nakhimova.

After the so-called ceremony and speeches, two dozen cadets came out of the building opposite and started loudly singing the national anthem of Ukraine. The boys thus expressed their disagreement with the actions of the separatists, and also condemned Russia's annexation of the peninsula. Almost immediately, when the cadets started singing the national anthem, they wanted to drown them out with the help of an orchestra. However, the boys sang until the end, after which they saluted and returned to the building of the educational institution.

In April, 103 cadets left the temporarily occupied Crimea for Odesa together with part of the command and teaching staff. From that time, a new history of the Ukrainian fleet began.

event: Serial Killer Sentenced to Life Imprisonment
description: Radik Tagirov, a resident of Kazan, was sentenced to life imprisonment for committing 31 murders, 3 attempted murders, and 33 robberies against elderly women in 15 Russian cities. He posed as a utility worker to gain access to victims' apartments, where he strangled and stole from them.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
A resident of Kazan was sentenced to life imprisonment for a series of crimes against elderly women committed in 15 cities of Russia. The evidence collected by the Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia was recognized by the Supreme Court of the Republic of Tatarstan as sufficient to sentence Radik Tagirov for committing the 31st murder and 3 attempted murders. and 33 robberies against elderly women.

These crimes were committed from March 2011 to October 2012. Tagirov acted in the same way: he found lonely elderly women and entered their apartments, posing as a utility worker. There he struck and strangled the victims, after which he stole money from the apartments.

Tagirov’s victims included 34 elderly women in Kazan, Nizhnekamsk, Volzhsk, Izhevsk, Nizhny Novgorod, Cheboksary, Ufa, Perm, Yekaterinburg, Saratov, Ivanovo, Kirov, Samara, Chelyabinsk and Moscow.

The crimes remained unsolved for a long time. The investigation had data on the criminal’s genotype and worked on different versions. More than 10 thousand people were tested for involvement in crimes, and more than 5 thousand expert studies were conducted. In 2020, the criminal was exposed and detained.

description: Radik Tagirov, known as the Volozhsk maniac, was sentenced to life imprisonment for killing 31 pensioners. He posed as a utility worker, targeting lonely elderly women, beating and strangling them, and stealing their money. His crimes went unsolved for almost ten years before his detention in 2020.
original:
“Until she went limp, he held her, then put her on the bed.”‼️The court sentenced the “Volozhsk maniac,” who killed 31 pensioners, to life imprisonment. The crimes remained unsolved for a long time; they were looking for a resident of Kazan, Radik Tagirov, for almost ten years; they managed to detain him in 2020 .

The killer was looking for lonely old women. Posing as a utility worker, he entered elderly women's apartments, beat and strangled them, and then took the money and left.

Tagirov operated not only in the capital of Tatarstan - he also found his victims in Nizhnekamsk, Volzhsk, Izhevsk, Nizhny Novgorod, Cheboksary, Ufa, Perm, Yekaterinburg, Saratov, Ivanovo, Kirov, Samara, Chelyabinsk and Moscow.

According to the court decision, the “strangler” will spend the first 10 years of his sentence in prison, the remaining term in a special regime correctional colony. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: A naval tactical group of the Kola Flotilla of the Northern Fleet conducted planned combat training tasks in the Barents Sea. The group, consisting of small anti-submarine ships Snezhnogorsk and Brest, and small missile ship Rassvet, practiced joint artillery firing at sea and air targets, deploying a naval group at sea, searching for submarines, repelling an air raid and unmanned aerial vehicles, and fighting unmanned boats.
original:
A naval tactical group of the Kola Flotilla of heterogeneous forces of the Northern Fleet entered the Barents Sea to practice planned combat training tasks. The small anti-submarine ships Snezhnogorsk and Brest, as well as the small missile ship Rassvet, will operate as part of the group at sea for several days.

The sailors will conduct a series of exercises and perform a complex of joint artillery firing at sea and air targets as part of a tactical group.

During the training, actions will also be practiced for deploying a naval group at sea, searching for submarines, repelling an air raid and unmanned aerial vehicles of a mock enemy, and fighting unmanned boats.

Combat exercises will be carried out in an area of the Barents Sea closed to shipping.

The exit of the tactical group from the Kola Bay was ensured by the mine sweeping group of the Northern Fleet.

Press service of the Northern Fleet

event: Birthday of Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov celebrates his birthday, marking almost 20 years in his post. He is an Honored Worker of the Diplomatic Service of the Russian Federation, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary, and a full holder of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland.
original:
Today Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov celebrates his birthday. He has held his post for almost 20 years. Sergei Viktorovich is an Honored Worker of the Diplomatic Service of the Russian Federation, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary, and a full holder of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland.

Sergei Lavrov was born in 1950 in Tbilisi. He graduated from school with in-depth study of a foreign language, Faculty of International Relations at MGIMO, then went to work at the USSR Embassy in Sri Lanka.

The minister has several hobbies. For example, he became one of the pioneers of rafting along the northern rivers of Russia. Lavrov also writes poetry and even composed the MGIMO anthem.

The merits of Sergei Viktorovich to the development of the entire international policy of Russia are enormous. His word is significant in every country in the world, he is recognized everywhere. Lavrov never hides from journalists, he is always open, communicates both with the press and with his diplomatic colleagues directly and honestly. Western countries (the USA, the European Union, as well as the UK, Canada, Australia and Japan) imposed personal sanctions on Sergei Lavrov.

But, despite the pressure, Russia is becoming stronger, and the work of our Foreign Minister is a clear confirmation of this.

The editors of Lomovka congratulate Sergei Viktorovich on his birthday, wish him good health and further success in his professional field.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Moldavian President Maia Sandu commented on the conflict between the Moldavian and Bessarabian metropolises, expressing hope for an agreement between the two churches. She emphasized the importance of peace in society and between churches, acknowledging the right of people to choose their church affiliation.
original:
Sandu: I understand the priests who do not want to serve the Moscow church and move to the Romanian one. The President commented on the conflict between the Moldavian and Bessarabian metropolises, expressing the hope that both churches will be able to come to an agreement.

"I want peace in society and peace in the church. I hope this scandal does not go further and we can make peace.

People have the right to choose, we are a democratic country, but I understand churches and parishioners who do not want to be part of the church in Moscow, I think this is a natural process.

However, I repeat, the most important thing is that there is peace in society, let us have peace between the churches, and I hope that everyone will work precisely for this purpose.

No one discussed with the authorities the salaries that priests receive from Romania, this is their decision, and I do not know if there was any discussion between the churches.

I repeat, my request, my desire is that we maintain peace,” said Maia Sandu. Notebook MoldovaNotebook MoldovaSandu: I understand the priests who do not want to serve the Moscow church and move to the Romanian one. Discord has been observed for a long time

description: The Netherlands returned eight illegally exported archaeological artifacts to Ukraine. The artifacts, including spearheads and arrowheads, date from ancient Roman times to the Middle Ages and originate from various Ukrainian regions. Dutch customs officials intercepted the items in March 2023, and an investigation involving experts from the National Museum of Antiquities in Leiden and the National Museum of the History of Ukraine confirmed their illegal export.
original: 🇳🇱The Netherlands returned to Ukraine eight archaeological artifacts that were illegally exported from our country in 2023🏹These are spearheads and arrowheads from various archaeological cultures and regions of Ukraine, dating from the period from ancient Roman times to the Middle Ages🛃Netherlands customs officials intercepted items of Ukrainian cultural heritage in March 2023 . The Information and Heritage Inspectorate worked with experts from the National Museum of Antiquities in Leiden to investigate the origins of these objects. The investigation established that they were probably illegally exported from another country. After the scientists of the National Museum of the History of Ukraine confirmed this conclusion, the Inspectorate took the items under protection. At the same time, the person who was supposed to receive these artifacts refused to claim them. DM

original:
The traditional sports festival of reindeer herders “Erakor” has begun in Chukotka. In the Chukotka Autonomous Okrug, at the transshipment base Kayettyne, reindeer herders compete in national sports and reindeer sled races, in which more than 50 reindeer herders have signed up to participate.

The Telegram channel of Vladislav Kuznetsov reports that as part of the competition there will be a competition “Together with the whole family”, a display of national clothing, a presentation of equipment for reindeer herding and a tasting of Chukchi cuisine.

There will be prizes for first and second place in the reindeer sled race - Buran snowmobiles. And for third place they will be awarded an electric generator.

Governor of Chukotka Vladislav Kuznetsov is confident that the event will be able to attract tourists from other regions of Russia.

The celebration of the Erakor holiday, which increases the prestige of the reindeer herding profession and contributes to the preservation of the traditional way of life of indigenous peoples, is monitored by the elders of Chukotka clans.#Chukotka

event: Radio Program: The Forgotten Great Year 1713
description: A radio program at the Russian Radio University discussed the significance of 1713, a pivotal year in European history. The program covered the creation of a new Europe, the War of the Spanish Succession, and the rise of Russia as a great power. It also touched on the role of the Russian army in Germany, the decline of the Spanish and Ottoman empires, and the loss of Polish sovereignty.
original:
Forwarded from: Radio Russia
TODAY AT 13:10 Moscow time at the Russian Radio University!
 
Theme of the program: The forgotten great year 1713. Peter the Great and the new multipolar world About the creation of a new Europe in 1713, about the significance of the “Peace of Utrecht” at the end of the War of the Spanish Succession, how England became the British Empire, about the fading of the Spanish and Ottoman empires, how Poland lost its sovereignty, about the main role of the Russian army in Germany, how Russia became a great power in 1713, how St. Petersburg became the capital of Russia, how England shouted menacingly about the inadmissibility of a complete victory for Russia, about the creation of a new multipolar world, when Charles XII hurried to Sweden to the besieged Stralsund, about England’s promises to help Sweden fight with Peter “to the last Swede”, about the successful actions of the Russian army in Finland, about the attempts of the Swedish fleet to turn the tide of the war in 1714, how Peter ordered to drag part of the galleys across the Gangut Peninsula, about the first great victory of the Russian fleet off the Gangut Peninsula on August 9, 1714 years, why Peter compared the victory at Gangut with the victory in the Battle of Poltava, about the first raids of the Russian army on the original Swedish territories, why England did not rush to help Sweden, how Prussia became related to Russia, about consolidating Russia’s position in Europe, about the victorious war between Austria and Turkey in 1714, about Russia’s decisive intervention in Polish affairs, why the Saxon Elector Augustus II wanted to become a full-fledged Polish king, how Peter played the role of an arbiter in Polish affairs, about the “Silent Diet” of 1717, how Peter’s decisions radically changed Russian-Polish relations - watch and listen to the continuation of the series "Peter the Great and His Empire".

Visiting the Russian Radio University is Igor Olegovich Knyazky, Doctor of Historical Sciences, Professor, Honorary Worker of Higher Professional Education in Russia.

Video broadcast on the WATCH platform, in the Telegram channel of Radio Russia and on the VKontakte page @radiorossii

A resident of the Donetsk People's Republic was sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of two adults and a child.

As established by the investigation and the court, the defendant, motivated by jealousy, shot at his partner and her friend from a pistol he kept. The victims died on the spot from their injuries. The investigation collected a sufficient evidence base, and the court sentenced the man to life imprisonment.

event: Death of Woman Due to Sepsis
description: A 32-year-old woman in Novorossiysk was hospitalized with poisoning and died due to sepsis. She was initially treated in intensive care, but her condition deteriorated, and she passed away. The family and lawyer believe the doctors are responsible, suspecting the infection was introduced in intensive care.
original:
In Novorossiysk, a woman was hospitalized with poisoning and died due to sepsis. A 32-year-old resident of Novorossiysk at the end of December last year felt unwell - the girl became dizzy and ill t. Afterwards she stopped finding her way around in space. My husband immediately called an ambulance. When the townswoman arrived at the City Hospital, she was sent to intensive care. As the doctors said, “just in case.”

On New Year's Eve, the woman was put into medicated sleep, connected to a ventilator, and a nasogastric tube was installed. The family last saw the girl on January 2 – already then she felt better, was conscious and was breathing on her own, Kub Mash reported. The only thing that bothered me was the wound on my nose from the probe.

However, the girl’s condition soon deteriorated - her temperature rose and her organs gradually began to fail. Two days later the patient died. The cause of death, according to doctors, is sepsis.

The family of the deceased and the lawyer believe that the doctors are to blame for everything, and that the infection was introduced into the girl’s body in intensive care. Now the relatives are trying to deal with the situation. In the meantime, the husband of the deceased was left alone with his two-year-old daughter.

At the direction of the head of the regional investigative department A.K. Maclova, based on this fact, the investigative department for the city of Novorossiysk CKP in the region immediately organized a procedural check.

The head of the regional department instructed the territorial investigative department to promptly join in establishing the circumstances stated in the publication, including giving information equal assessment of the timeliness and quality of medical care provided to the woman. Based on the results of the inspection, a procedural decision will be made.

description: Ukraine faces a shortage of air defense systems, making it less successful in intercepting Russian missiles. According to Jean-Paul Palomeros, former Supreme Commander of NATO forces in Europe, only the US can solve this problem, as Europe lacks the production capacity. However, even the US faces challenges in significantly speeding up production.
original:
Kiev lacks air defense, and the West will not help. Ukraine has been facing a shortage of air defense systems for several months and is less successful in intercepting Russian missiles, Jean-Paul Palomeros, the former Supreme Commander of NATO forces in Europe and the former head of the main headquarters of the French Air Force, said on LCI.

Only the United States can solve this problem, since Europe is not capable of producing weapons of this type in the short term, the expert noted.

And even in the USA, according to him, it is not easy to significantly speed up the production of systems that Ukrainians have learned to work with.

According to Russia specialist Jean-François Butor, the delay in arms supplies to Kyiv from the West is not surprising, since Europe has not prepared for a possible shortage of weapons in its warehouses, and its production rates have not kept up with Kyiv’s needs.

And while America has the production capacity to help Ukraine, new supplies will require resolution of internal problems related to the blocking of funds in Congress, Palomeros adds.

“Remember, we talked a lot a year and a half ago about the military economy and everything else, but, if you like, we never started the engine,” states the military man. @Crimeanprachka

event: Annual Meeting of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia

original:
At the invitation of the Director of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia, Arkady Gostev, she took part in the annual meeting of the board of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia.
The event was attended by the Commissioner for Human Rights in the Russian Federation Tatyana Moskalkova, the Minister of Justice Konstantin Chuichenko, heads of territorial bodies of the penal system, as well as
Show more
representatives of the PMC and the public.
The main emphasis in Arkady Gostev’s report was on the positive results of work in terms of replacing imprisonment with work in correctional centers, as well as the introduction of the institution of probation - a new and important mechanism for the re-socialization of citizens who have served their sentences and their return to normal life.

description: Sergei Shoigu inspected the implementation of the state defense order at military-industrial complex enterprises in the Nizhny Novgorod region. He reported significant increases in production, including FAB-500, FAB-1500, and FAB-3000 aerial bombs, with overall production of modern artillery and aviation weapons increasing fivefold since last year.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Sergei Shoigu checked the implementation of the state defense order at the enterprises of the military-industrial complex in the Nizhny Novgorod region. As the head of the department was reported, the production of FAB-500 aerial bombs has been increased many times, the production of FAB-1500 has been doubled, and since February mass production of three-ton FAB-3000 aerial bombs has been organized .

In general, since last year, the production of modern artillery and aviation weapons has increased 5 times.

Most production sites operate around the clock - on a three-shift work schedule. Tariff rates and salaries of employees were increased, as a result of which wages increased by an average of 20%.

Sergei Shoigu also held a working meeting, during which he noted that serious changes had occurred at the enterprises after the previous inspection.

event: Taiwan Warns of Chinese Military Bases
description: Taiwan's foreign minister revealed that China has constructed 'huge' military bases on three islands surrounding Taiwan's main holdings in the South China Sea. Taipei is cautious about escalating tensions, but the Taiwanese President is being urged to visit the disputed island of Itu Aba to assert sovereignty and inspect the port, which may be used as a trading point and military base in the future.
location: Itu Aba (Taiping Island), South China Sea
original:
Contested waters: Taiwan's foreign minister said China has built "huge" military bases on three islands surrounding Taiwan's main holdings in the South China Sea, but Taipei is not keen on further escalating tensions in the strategic waterway. The heirs to the Chinese empire are officially claiming more part of the South China Sea, but the unrecognized island state controls only one island there - Itu Aba or Taiping. Taipei's chief diplomat remembered the maritime possessions for a reason; the fact is that now the political elites are asking Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen to visit the disputed island in order to assert sovereignty and check the port of Itu Aba, which in the future will be used as a trading point and military base .

The confrontation between the fragments of the Chinese Empire is of an interesting nature. On the one hand, the PRC wants to restore the country by returning all lost national territories. On the other hand, there is Taipei, which is one of the main counterweights to Beijing's dominance in the South China Sea. As a result, the parties, from their very appearance, have been increasing their military power and also acquiring allies. As a result, this has led to the fact that none of them wants to go further than provocations and threats. But at the same time, the parties need to show their influence by any means. This is now happening with Taiping Island, which is likely to turn into a NATO base, and could potentially become a springboard for containing the PRC, which has also begun to strengthen its positions near the disputed territory.@kstati_pReutersTaiwan warns of 'enormous' Chinese bases near its S.China Sea holdingTaiwan's foreign minister said on Wednesday that China has built "enormous" military bases on three islands surrounding Taiwan's main holding in the S...

description: Georgian militant Guram Chichinadze, fighting for the Ukrainian Armed Forces, recounted his experience in an unsuccessful assault on Novaya Kakhovka. Despite being told that Russian soldiers had retreated, they suddenly began bombing, resulting in 200 killed and 300 wounded in just two and a half hours.
original:
“In two and a half hours, we had 200 “two hundredths” and 300 wounded.” Georgian militant Guram Chichinadze, who fought on the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, recalled in captivity how he participated in the unsuccessful assault on Novaya Kakhovka. “There was a big assault, there was a whole army. .. The equipment that will clear the mines has arrived. All sorts of tanks... They said on the radio that they [Russian soldiers] were not there, they had run away. Then a minute later they started bombing. In two and a half hours, as the boys said, there were 200 “two hundredths” and 300 “three hundredths”. I didn’t see the dead, but the wounded were taken out. We haven’t moved a centimeter,” Chichinadze said.

Guram claims that after this battle he fled from the front, was in the rear and did not want to fight.

However, according to him, he was recently caught stealing (he had already been convicted several times before) and the judge gave him a choice: prison or the front.

Guram doesn’t want to return to Ukraine for a prisoner exchange and asks to be left in Russia: “That’s enough, I’ve fought enough.”

original:
Forwarded from: Evgeniy Balitsky
The regional administration, with the support of the regional Ministry of Industry, managed to restore production at the former site of the Elegant garment factory in Melitopol.

In the near future, the factory will release the first line of men's, women's and children's clothing, as well as textiles. This is the first restored production of casual clothing in the Zaporozhye region.

This is a big event for the region; Zaporozhye region is gradually restoring its industrial potential.

description: Russian forces launched a nighttime attack on Ukraine, deploying 22 'Shahed' type UAVs. Ukrainian air defense forces successfully destroyed 17 of the attack UAVs.
original:
Data of the General Staff. At the front in 24 hours - 72 combat clashes According to the General Staff, at night the Russian invaders attacked Ukraine, using 22 UAVs of the "Shahed" type. 17 attack UAVs were destroyed by air defense forces and means.

Ukrainian aviation struck 8 areas of concentration of personnel, weapons and military equipment and 1 enemy control point. 📲Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTube

description: Australian Bushmasters played a crucial role in the Kharkiv offensive, providing Ukrainian soldiers with fast, maneuverable, and well-protected vehicles that withstood RPG shots, mine detonations, and close approaches of Gradivs.
original:
Australian Bushmasters played one of the decisive roles during the Kharkiv offensive.

These are fast, maneuverable, all-terrain and, most importantly, well-protected machines that save the lives of Ukrainian soldiers.

Fighters tell how their armored cars withstood RPG shots, detonations of mines, close approaches of "Gradivs". And yet Bushmaster continues to liberate Ukrainian territories.@AFUStratComStratCom of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on social networksFacebook|YouTube|InstagramX🇺🇦|WhatsApp|Podcast|X🇬🇧
